org.crossover.util

Class NumberPrettifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.crossover.util.NumberPrettifier

  • public class NumberPrettifier
extends java.lang.Object
    NumberPrettifier class Utility class that accepts a numeric type and returns a truncated, "prettified" string version. The prettified version will include one number after the decimal when the truncated number is not an integer. Prettifies numbers greater than 6 digits and support millions, billions and trillions. Short scale numbers are used to output the prettified number. Examples: 
                    input: 1000000 output: 1M

                input: 2500000.34 output: 2.5M

                input: 532 output: 532

                input: 1123456789 output: 1.1B*
    Author:
    Carlos Carrascal Sanchez

    • Constructor Detail

      • NumberPrettifier

        public NumberPrettifier()
        Empty constructor. Defaults to US locale, using "." for decimals

      • NumberPrettifier

        public NumberPrettifier(java.util.Locale locale)
        Constructor using Locale class. Using this constructor the character used for decimal separator will be displayed according the Locale used. Example: 
        NumberPrettifier prettifier = new NumberPrettifier(new Locale("es", "ES"));
        Parameters:
        locale - Locale class to user for output format
        See Also:
        Locale

    • Method Detail

      • format

        public java.lang.String format(java.lang.Double input)
        Format a number into a truncated, "prettified" string version. Negative numbers are allowed and formated in the same way.
        Parameters:
        input - Number to be formatted.
        Returns:
        The formatted number in String.

        Returns:
        The formatted number in String.

      • formatValue

        public static java.lang.String formatValue(java.lang.Double input)
        Static method to format a number. This method does the same as format(Double) but can be called statically. Example: 
        String number = NumberPrettifier.formatValue(1000D);
        Parameters:
        input - Number to be formatted.
        Returns:
        The formatted number in String.
        See Also:
        format(Double input)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Static main method to te able to excute this class from the command line. This method expects a number parameter as input for the format() function. Example (run from the base dir, where the file build.xml is located): 
        java -cp bin org.crossover.util.Prettifier 250000
